TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit ReadOnlyTensorSpan`1<T> extends System.ValueType
generic <typename T> public value class ReadOnlyTensorSpan

Docs.summary: Represents a contiguous region of arbitrary memory. Unlike arrays, it can point to either managed or native memory, or to memory allocated on the stack. It is type-safe and memory-safe.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Array array) cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new over the provided . The new will have a rank of 1 and a length equal to the length of the provided .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(!T* data, native int dataLength) cil managed

Docs.param: An unmanaged data that points to memory.
The number of elements the unmanaged memory can hold.
Docs.summary: Creates a new span over the target unmanaged buffer.
Docs.remarks: Clearly this is quite dangerous the length is not checked. But if this creation is correct, then all subsequent uses are correct.

Docs.param: The number of elements the unmanaged memory can hold.
The lengths of the dimensions. If default is provided, it's assumed to have one dimension with a length equal to the length of the data.
The lengths of the strides. If nothing is provided it figures out the default stride configuration.
Docs.summary: Creates a new span over the target unmanaged buffer. Clearly this is quite dangerous, because the length is not checked. But if this creation is correct, then all subsequent uses are correct.
Docs.exception: is reference type or contains pointers and hence cannot be stored in unmanaged memory.

Docs.param: The index at which to begin the span.
The lengths of the dimensions. If default is provided, it's assumed to have one dimension with a length equal to the length of the data.
The strides of each dimension. If default or span of length 0 is provided then strides will be automatically calculated.
Docs.summary: Creates a new span over the portion of the target array beginning at the specified start index and ending at the end index (exclusive).
Docs.exception: is covariant and its type is not exactly T[].
The specified or end index is not in the range (<0 or >FlattenedLength).

.method public static hidebysig valuetype System.Numerics.Tensors.ReadOnlyTensorSpan`1<!T> CastUp<class (!T) TDerived>(valuetype System.Numerics.Tensors.ReadOnlyTensorSpan`1<!!TDerived> items) cil managed
Public Shared Function CastUp(Of TDerived As {Class, T}) (items As ReadOnlyTensorSpan(Of TDerived)) As ReadOnlyTensorSpan(Of T)

Docs.typeparam: The element type of the source read-only span, which must be derived from .
Docs.param: The source read-only span. No copy is made.
Docs.summary: Casts a read-only span of to a read-only span of .
Docs.returns: A read-only span with elements cast to the new type.
Docs.remarks: This method uses a covariant cast, producing a read-only span that shares the same memory as the source. The relationships expressed in the type constraints ensure that the cast is a safe operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(valuetype System.Numerics.Tensors.TensorSpan`1<!T> destination) cil managed
Public Sub CopyTo (destination As TensorSpan(Of T))

Docs.param: The span to copy items into.
Docs.summary: Copies the contents of this read-only span into destination span. If the source and destinations overlap, this method behaves as if the original values are in a temporary location before the destination is overwritten.
Docs.exception: The destination ReadOnlyTensorSpan is shorter than the source ReadOnlyTensorSpan.

Docs.summary: Returns a reference to the 0th element of the ReadOnlyTensorSpan.
Docs.remarks: If the ReadOnlyTensorSpan is empty, returns reference. It can be used for pinning and is required to support the use of span within a fixed statement.

Docs.param: The span to copy items into.
Docs.summary: Copies the contents of this read-only span into destination span. If the source and destinations overlap, this method behaves as if the original values are in a temporary location before the destination is overwritten.
Docs.returns: if the copy succeeds. If the destination span is shorter than the source span, this method return and no data is written to the destination.
